- [Mike] We are "Sorted," a
group of mates from London

exploring the newest and
best in the world of food

whilst trying to have a
few laughs along the way.

(laughing)
We've got chefs.

We've got normals.

And a whole world of
stuff for you to explore,
but everything we do starts with you.

- Well, hello. Welcome to our fridge.
This is Mike, and I'm Ben.
- And you lovelies, shall we see

- At the end, Mike is

this one you're going to enjoy.

That's got Evers written all over it.

We've got some beautiful

honey, coffee, tomatoes, eggs.
- We have a lovely crusty loaf of bread.
Parmesan, classic.

- Something creamy.

- Whoa! Whoa, whoa, whoa!

You're putting that into a custard,

The main flavor in my custard

- [Ben] You're just making a sandwich.
- I'm just making a sandwich.

- Oh, then. How long are fish's fingers?

- It's a fish hand.

- I'm not here to do

Fish goes in.

I want a really crisp,

- I think, yeah. Historically.

- So your custard is on,

Always flip away from you.
It doesn't splash you.

It splashes a cameraman.

You are 15 minutes through,

- I've decided to do something
that might be really silly.

- [Jamie] Oh. Oh, no, no. What

- [Jamie] Wow.
- Let's make custard!

♪ Hopefully when scrambled ♪
♪ Do a bit at a time ♪
To stabilize the eggs.

- Oh! That your measurements!

Measurements!

What were you going for?
- Barry, you are halfway through.

Those two hobs are on.

Are they all right?
- Yep. Shut up!
How much corn flour do you add?
- [Ben] How do you pour flour?

- Just don't know.

- Oh, I'm sorry. Sorry, Evers.

- I think it's fair to say that panic

- Custard. Why am I making custard?

What a stupid idea, Barry!
That's not gonna thicken up.

Just put some more

right in there.

- Classically, egg yolk, sugar, vanilla,
and then add your flour in at that stage.
Then warm up your infused milk.
The vanilla can be in either or both.
Then add hot milk into egg yolk,
then back into a pan to slowly thicken

as it comes up to temperature,
stirring continuously.

Best to add the corn flour
in earlier rather than later.
- Thank you!

- Well in the news, we
have 10 minutes to go.
Ten minutes remaining!

Bread's looking good.

- [Ben] Tell you what, Baz.
- That's gonna be nice and smooth.
- So 10 minutes, yeah? Parmesan crisps.

I think that's perfectly done.

- Do you want to go run that under water?

- There it is.

- Nurse Spafford and

- I just want to know which

- one looks nice.

- [Jamie] I think you got this, mate.

- Twenty seconds.

- I'm happy at those.

That's amazing.

Really weird but really

That's brand new for me.

That is a very, very, very good dish.

- I feel like I got stuff on my face.

These are, like, size 10 feet.

I want to try the vanilla
